desc: In about 180-200 pages I wish to describe various infertility stories that have happened in two different countries (UK and Greece),  within the past 24 years, trying to give insight to infertility patients mainly, also to colleagues and lay people. I have thought that the story could be based on autobiographic description, also, asking some of the available patients to give their own truth in a short way. The story will show the way I matured in a such a complicated task, trying to balance between the cruelty of an inconvenient situation of patients' infertility and the sensitivity that the english way of medical training enforces somebody to pursuit. It will give some information about how some patients have their ups and downs during that journey and how much and what kind of qualities one should have to support them. All that described in an absolutely down to earth way enriched with humour, as well as sensitivity that is definitely demanded in such an interesting and complicated task. A task that one needs to combine knowledge, tactile skills, patience, kindness, generosity many times and perfect team spirit. All that combined in a perfect way, so that couples will eventually get the best benefit out of it, without suffering any damages at [url removed, login to view] the same time offering such a privilege to me to deal with that, getting myself mature, trying at the same time not to burn myself out.
title: infertility book based on autobiography as na infertility specialist
